label: 迦陵頻伽
本: A Tale of Flowering Fortunes:  Annals of Japanese Aristocratic Life in the Heian Period (Volumes One and Two) . Stanford University Press . 1980
説明文: Sometimes identified as a Himalayan songbird, but the author undoubtedly has in mind an alternative theory based on the Amitābha Sutra, which describes it as a human-headed bird that warbles expositions of the dharma in the Pure Land (p. 539n).
